Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: Automated Clothing Simulation and Human Avatar Generation Engine
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is to empower retailers with tools that enable them to make a meaningful reduction in the number of returns generated from e-commerce purchases. It is anticipated that a valuable opportunity will emerge to leverage the newly generated data for better recommendation algorithms, improved forecasting, and enhanced marketing efforts. The retail industry is at a pivotal point because physical locations are becoming increasingly difficult to sustain, leading retailers to develop a stronger online presence. A major challenge preventing fashion retailers from expanding their online presence is the high rate of returns for e-commerce (30-50%) vs. in-store (8.9%) purchases. In addition to the monetary cost of returns ($40 B), there is a significant impact on the environment with billions of pounds of goods going to landfills due to returns.

This I-Corps project will deliver accurate human body analogues from minimal user inputs, realistic clothing simulations from non-standardized design and manufacturing files, and an automated integration into credible fit visualizations. The technology provides 1) an automated process for turning design files into photo realistic 3D simulations, 2) an automated process for generating an accurate shadow avatar, and 3) a process by which the avatar and simulation can be combined and multiple meshes layered using position-based dynamics. The technological implementation of this team's approach utilizes deep learning and machine learning algorithms, 3D modeling, mesh generation and mapping, a custom rendering engine, and advanced fabric simulation techniques.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The apparel industry is at a pivotal point. Brick and mortar locations are becoming increasingly more difficult to sustain necessitating that brands develop a stronger online presence. One of the biggest challenges preventing apparel brands from expanding their online business is the high rate of returns for e-commerce (30-50%) vs. in-store (8.9%) purchases, primarily due to fit and sizing issues. In addition to the monetary cost of these returns ($100B), there is a significant impact on the environment with billions of pounds of goods going straight to landfills each year directly due to returns. This cost and the amount of waste generated is unsustainable. 

The Couture Technologies team entered the National Science Foundation's I-Corps program to evaluate the commercial opportunity for a virtual try on solution and determine whether a reduction in the rate of returns generated from e-commerce purchases was a primary value proposition for leadership within apparel companies. The team conducted 122 interviews during the 7-week I-Corps program and another 90 interviews during the award period after the program concluded. This customer discovery led them to identify an early adopter customer segment and validate that a reduction in returns was indeed a powerful value proposition. The team developed a Business Model Canvas and made strong connections with potential early adopters. 

During the award period, the team secured both its first unpaid pilot and its first paid pilot from connections made during customer discovery. They were invited to present on Fashion Sustainability during Design Week, in addition to being invited to present to luxury brands in Milan, Italy. They were identified as a top tech startup by Collision, the Olympics of Tech and a Hot Retail Tech by the Retail Fast Forward Group. The team received an NSF SBIR award ($256K, Award #2026135) and $10K in grant funding from LaunchTN.

The entrepreneurial lead was invited to serve as an adjunct instructor for the National I-Corps program after completion of the program. The I-Corps program provided an invaluable opportunity for the team to learn commercialization skills, gain industry knowledge, and make connections through their customer discovery that have propeled their company forward at an accelerated rate.
